content: Great game bugs finally fixed !

Almost 1:1 remake of the original gameboy. It's is a lot easier since you are no longer constrained to four directions, and now the spells have some auto targeting, but apart from the 3d face-lift, this will strike you as the exact game you remember. Oh, that also means your npc partners and enemy mobs are just as stupid as they were before. Also, make sure to pack plenty of mattocks and keys, so you don't get stuck... thankfully, I remembered that from when I was a kid.

Absolutely fantastic remake. I loved the original on Game Boy back in the 90s and this remake does not disappoint. This is actually one of the best RPGs you can get on Android. I see a lot of people complaining about the controls, but I don't have an issue with them. They definitely aren't perfect but the game is very playable and the controls are good enough to enjoy the game. Right away I noticed the beautiful graphics and high FPS. This is like Zelda meets Final Fantasy. So much fun to play!
This is a good game. I've had it for a while, and i wish there was more Android stuff out there like this! haha
This is an awesome and pretty faithful remake/remaster of the game boy game Final fantasy adventure.
Bought it a while ago and beat it then redownloaded it later and beating it again. A classic a great port and a good buy for multiple runs over time

Played a huge chunk of the game. Went in to a dungen and when i got out my chocobo had spawn on a other island... No way of getting it back.. Looked up and this is a common bug. you need to restart the entire game to continue. Game is great tho
Love it.
Unintuitive game with poor controls. Not fun to play since there's no explanation of what to do in the game. Need a walkthrough to progress. Very disappointed.
Got stuck in it twice gave up.
game keeps randomly freezing and crashes. lost my save file multiple times in the past. the game was better on gameboy. Would not advise purchase due to lack of updates.

As far as gameplay goes its okay not great, but then there's this bug that is ridiculous so if you get poisoned and die when you hit continue to start up again from the quick save, your still poisoned and die again instantly.. please fix this square enix...

I've been playing (mostly free) hack and slash rpg apps for a while and I loved the look of this game. After paying the enormous amount for this port I realized only after a couple minutes of gameplay how simplistic and unintuitive this game really is. Compared to other games I've played the controls aren't very responsive to the dodgey enemies, there are barely any variety of skills or items and the entire game is so dumbed down to suit a toddler. Literally the only thing I liked was the style
As of 6/21/20 this game played flawlessly,even on my cheap p.o.s.phone without any bugs or crashes..great game..worth every penny.
A remake of the first mana game on Gameboy . It was called Final Fantasy Adventure.
It's fun
Amazing experience, great story, intuitive controls and gorgeous visuals that stay try to original artstyle
Can't get on the damn chocobo! Because of this I can't get across the broken bridge south of Menos. Fix it!
Great Game
Awesome game! Good controls! Nice port!
Awesome to have another 'Mana' game for Android, hopefully Trials of Mana is next!
Loved final fantasy adventure and I love this perfect good job as always square enix!
Glitchy Mess
Playable female protagonist removed...

Joyous! This game advantage Zelda in many ways! If you look for a classic old school zelda game in your phone this is it. (Same problem in the INVENTORY space just the game boy but thats ok ^^) im gonna download it again to see if theres any changes but i doubt it. Never the less a GREAT GAME!

TL;DR; My one advice if you play this game: Save on normal save slots often. My quicksave is unrecoverable and I lost all progress near the end of the game. Having been a secret of mana and final fantasy fan for decades, I was excited to play this. I had few complaints until I got near the end of the game and a monster poisoned me near low health and I moved forward a screen. Now the quicksave is saved on my moment of death and no trickery seems able to revive my character. So I guess I'm done
It feels nostalgic
Love playing this game!
One of my favorite games ever. Love it..!

Glitch on the roof of the mansion in jadd is preventing me from progressing. I never usually spend so much purchasing a game but i loved this game before so i thought id give it a go. Please fix this glitch so i can carry on and give you 5stars. Update** glitch didnt happen on a new file. Game is awesome :)
Did not work

Much better now that the crashing issue has been fixed. Used to be that having too many sprites on the screen (e.g. in some boss fights) would crash the game instantly. Nice to see that it's been fixed. I was able to beat the game on my Galaxy S7 Edge with barely any issues.

Do yourself a favor and do not download this BullS... It has a had time downloading and when I finally get it downloaded, the gameplay is unstable! Try to refund and you get a "does not support our policy" message! Keep your $7!

Who ever gave this game a high rating was really on some serious drugs. Nothing about this game was exciting. The monsters in this game weren't challenging. They just roamed around even the help you gotten from other characters wasn't to great. Don't waste your money.

Great app. Really similar to the story and basic setup of the original Gameboy game. New graphics make It look axing, and the remade soundtrack is great. Also like how the option to change the games music to be the originals. Yes it is basic, and fairly short. But is definitely worth the money if your looking for a good jrpg.
Not bad, not great. Its no dragon quest
Lazy conversion with mad controls. Very disappointed
No notch support, so there's an ugly black bar on only one side of the screen. Fix that and it will be perfect.
Feels smooth and is fun.
Muito bom. Pena que n√£o est√° em portugu√™s.

Fun game but WAY TOO EASY! I hope square will add an option for harder game-play; for example double enemy stats or something.... Apart from not posing any difficulty it is a nice game and has a good story to it. Good controlls and easy to learn how to play.
Good game and no bugs that I found. Super confusing for s first timer like me.
Greatest

With the last update (which took for whatever good reason two full years!) game is running flawlessly now! Wonderful gem as a game and a great throwback to simpler times, with SEs usual chibi design! Love it and I am so thankfull to finally ve able to continue and bring the game to an end!
pretty fun though easy. just wish there was fast travel. trying to find already discovered locations was a pain

Having played Final Fantasy Adventure recently, it was a joy to get to experience that game with the updates. The original was excellent, and this remake fixes the minor problems and enhances things to make a good game great. I highly recommend this game to any who are interested in RPGs or who want to see how the Mana series began with an updated, modern format.

If you don't remember or haven't played the original, this plays a lot like a clone of the original Zelda. From the grid layout of the overworld to the action RPG combat system. This combat system however, has a little more depth. You can equip various types of weapons, & spells, which play a factor when dealing with weak or immune enemies or environmental objects (such as trees chopped with the axe or ghosts burned with a fire spell). Items are used to restore health, open a door, destroy enviro
Glitched into the stream in the first area and now I'm stuck forever and have to start over. Controls are awkward and unresponsive.
very nice despite touch screen controls
A great game to kick off my personal favorite game series!

i bought this game originaly brand new for the Gameboy when it was called Final Fantasy Adventure and its remake Sword of mana for tge GBA which I admit I didnt like as much as the original. But this version seems to be closer to FFA. Im enjoying it a lot. I feel like I'm 15 again playing this game.
The first time i loaded up the game, my character was t-posing and the first on-screen enemy was spinning in a circle. Didn't exactly inspire confidence to keep playing it past the refund timer.
My present concern is getting through the desert. Can anyone help?
Better than the GBA Version, well done.
very good classic adventure
worst game ever
great game and fun

the game would have gotten a 5 star but there is one part if you run out of keys you are stuck and you cant proceed. the part before you go up the waterfall. it is recomanded that you put a shopkepper there (developers) or take always 20 keys with you else you will realise the issue. the monsters there dont drop keys as well
easy but a lot of fun
I have completed the game and I really enjoyed the music and storyline. It's definitely nostalgic and classic as Well.
Excellent remake of a classic rpg. Touch runs smoothly and seemlessly.
The character was forced to go downpath at very beginning.
"app did not download because you may not have purchased it." there went 15.00
Great game! very stable after the Dec 18 update.
Pirated the game on an iPhone a while ago, it was a fun game. I didn't want to give apple my $10 or so when I was going to get an android soon, now I purchased a game I like.
I never played the original but I enjoyed it. The music was great as were the visuals.
Ran flawlessly from start to finish. Quicksave (auto) made it too easy. It looks great, sounds great, controls pretty well. You can use the strategy guides for the original game boy version.
Fun game, and finally works with the new update so i can finish it
an excellent remake of a classic..The touch controls are spot on
Squid boss crash has been fixed, go crazy
thanks now it is workingüòÅ
Loved the gameboy version so this was a fun for me as well.

Has not been updated since June 2016. Many bugs which have not been addressed. It appears game has been abandoned by developer with no intention to fix the long list of bugs reported in the reviews. 4.5 hours into the game it is now unplayable. I read the reviews but bought it anyway. Disappointed in Square Enix which has a great reputation but abandoned this game two and a half years ago.
Game crashes on squid boss and no way to progress. Really frustrating as this is usually a trusted brand developer :( :( :(
The game crashes at the Davias boss fight, and it's a glitch people have been hitting for years.  Seems lots of people are having this issue.

The game is great! I would give a 5 star, however, there is a bug at Davias boss that crashes it. I guess the animations are too much. Please fix or find a workaround for this. I already submitted a bug report. If you fix this and I can continue (without having to grind til I can 1 shot the boss...) then I'll give 5 stars! Until then I'm not playing. If never fixed, I'll demand a refund.

This is a remake of a very old Gameboy game called Final Fantasy adventure. I'm only a few hours in and despite the fresh coat of paint the game is spot on and follows the original very closely. I'd give it 5 stars but for the glitches... also you can get stuck without keys or matoks so keep a big stock on you before hitting a dungeon
Can get past the Flayer boss because the game keeps crashing. At first I thought it was my phone, so I tried my tablet, and 2 other phones and it still crashes at the same spot. I feel ripped off
Control pad is wonky. Please fix.

Borderline unplayable, constant force closes. On S9 and running android 8.0.0. First got scythe and it force closed about 5 times as I tried to escape the area where I needed to cut the grass. Now on Davius and I can't attack him without the game force closing. Spells, items, weapons, doesnt matter. Two attacks and it closes (10+ times) so I'm stuck now.
Crashing on the Davias boss the second day of game play. Sent feedback and had no reply. Got ripped off.
Bugged up

Good game but i think this game need update .. i play this game before in 
other version not in android.but this one keep crashing on davias boss..pls 
help us to solve this problem..thanks have nice day.

Fine until about half way through when it started crashing at the Davias 
boss. Playing on a galaxy S8+, no excuse.

I was loving the game until it completely blanked out on me. I tried 
emailing and I didn't get a reply. I feel like I wasted my money!

LG G6 crashing during main sequence. Never be able to finish the game. 
Would've been better to put these kind of graphics on a port of Sword of 
Mana instead since that was the same game with many expanded features. This 
is a near direct port of the original gameboy adventure. So sad.

I was enjoying the game up until I reached the Squid boss in the Old 
Mansion Roof top. I can't get pass this level without the game crashing 
everytime he shoots multiple fireballs at me. Please fix this so I can 
bring it back to 5 stars.

DO NOT BUY! Game crashes during rooftop davias fight. Fix or I'm requesting 
a refund. I didn't pay for half a game. I'm using a Galaxy S9+ so there's 
no way it's my phone.

Same problem as everyone else...gsme crashes st davias boss fight and red 
dragon. Red dragon bug impossible to work though...unacceptable for $15
Game will crash at Davias boss fight due to too many sprites on screen.  It has been reported for 11 months, and STILL hasn't been fixed.   Such a shame SE.

I was really enjoying this game but I've got to the old mansion boss and 
the app keeps crashing every time the boss does a certain move. I'm not at 
all happy about this and hope the devs sort it soon. Otherwise I have a 
game I can't play. I managed to progress tthrough the game and now I have 
the same problem but in the temple of mana at the red dragon boss. Only 
this time I can't find a spot in the screen to hide as the boss does the 
move the glitches the game. So I doubt I'll be able to get any further.

Stuck at Davias boss fight because it crashes because he throws so many 
spells that it just crashes. Please fix so that everyone that is having 
this problem can continue and beat this gun and amazing remake of final 
fantasy adventure.

Same issue as everyone else. Davias boss freezes making game unplayable. 
Fix for five stars.

Love the game but it crashes every time I fight the squid boss. Please fix 
this ASAP.

Its great but It crashes on a boss battle and I cant continue to the end 
still waiting for a update to fix crash.
It won't open on my S9.

Love the game but it closed during a cut scene and everytime I try to start 
the game I just get a white screen and cant do anything.
It won't let me get out the prison cell before it crashes.
Game crashes at Davias. 4 hours in and stuck. What a waste. Not happy
Brought back good memories :) I wanna have the sound track!!!

It jumps out when your playing the mansion in the area of the desert when 
your at the boss please fix this
A perfect flashback of FFA i love it!!

Easily a fivestar game if they fix the bugs. Im crashing at the octowizard 
in the desert

Honestly, I'm very disappointed. The game is good, very enjoyable, however, 
it crashes *constantly* on two boss fights: Medusa and the Red Dragon. I 
managed to bypass Medusa's crashes but not the Red Dragon's. This makes me 
unable to finish the game. For a buy to play game, this issues are 
unacceptable. A shame since I love Final Fantasy so much.
The game crashes when using the full gauge bar attack with a sickle
A perfect remake of the original Final Fantasy Adventure aka. Mystic Quest.

A fun game, decent story, but on Android it unavoidably crashes during the 
boss battle on the Jadd mansion rooftop. There are many other glitches too. 
Please fix.

I've always liked square enix games, but this game for android is super 
buggy. It has crashed on me a few times, but this last one keeps happening 
continually in the same boss battle in the tower were yo fight the red 
dragon. It always crashes in the same place after the dragon tries his 
flame thrower attack. How can you release a game with a major bug like this 
one. This didn't happen in the old era of gaming when games had to make the 
quality before the money.

The game keeps closing when I go to hit this Davias boss. After one hit, 
the game just stops and takes me to my home screen. Please fix. Great game. 
Galaxy Note 8

Fix this!!! It's an awesome game, and super kudos for supporting game pad 
controllers (touch screen controls are always trash, no matter what game) , 
but a glitch causes it to crash when there's too many sprites on screen at 
one time. I have a galaxy s8, so it's not like my phone can't handle it. 
I've even used the game tuner to scale the texture quality down to 10% and 
the screen resolution to 50% and it still happens on the Davias boss fight 
every time, so it's definitely not a lack of ram problem. I've played with 
framerate, performance modes, nothing works. FIX THIS SQUARE AND YOU GET 5 
STARS!!!

Like a lot of people here, I experienced a crash at boss fight completely blocking progression in the game. That is totally unacceptable for a $15 game, especially because the bug happens after a while, when it's too late to ask for a refund. I contacted both Square and Google to get a refund and they are playing ping pong with me, saying that refund should be done by the other. Don't buy this game!
This game crashes in 2 important fights making it impossible to beat. Devias and the Red Dragon.  Do not bother until these guys fix it

I love this game, but there are tons of people complaining that the Davias boss fight crashes, as well as others because of too many sprites. That's messed up for a game I shelled out 15 bucks for instead of pirating a rom, which I should have. F u c k you square enix.

Honestly one of my favorite titles on the gameboy, and despite other reviews decided to give it a try.  It's a good game til you reach the mansion roof, where it blows up after 30 to 45 seconds every time.  Makes the game unplayable.
Why i hate it easy i spend my money for the 1st time buying game on Google play and happy playing for a while suddenly when i reach the octopus boss the game crash
Halfway through the game the app continuously crashes when fighting a boss monster
Nice game, just finished it around 18 hours
Game crashes all the time.
crashed everytime at mansion roof against davias -_-
Keeps closing on boss at the mansion 5 hours in
It keeps crashing in the fight with Davias
Cant save on Galaxy tab A! Please fix
Game is unplayable as it crashes on davias fight every time Unbeatable and unrefundable 4 hours in
Game crashes at Davias, also crashes at Red Dragon every time he uses flames. I'm not sure how I got past Davias, but what a pain in the ass. No fix either it seems.
Fix game crashes on red dragon!
Game is broken. I get stuck on the boss on Jadd. 2nd game i have seen with major problem. 1st was FFXVPE. Contact them and all you get is automated messages. So frustrating. Terrible service
I'll give this a five-star once they fix the Davis boss crashing out bug for Google pixel 2.

Not what I was expecting and not in a good way. Boring, bland gameplay, a story that isn't explained at all as you go through it, very little connecting it with the other Mana titles, and a terrible control scheme. Inferior in every way to Sword of Mana.

A classic reborn. I love the Seiken Densetsu games. If you guys could localize SD3, and get the collection from switch ported to pc and consoles, I think that is what fans really want. SD Collection for western release for 2018!
I'd love to recommend this game but seriously devs, the game breaking bug at Davias STILL hasn't been fixed?
Terrific game. What else can you expect from Square Enix?? Pure awesomeness. Excellent work.
Game crashes every single time during Davias fight. Tried to play it on different device hoping it won't crash but the game still crashed. One star for an unplayable game.
Game crashed everytime the optopus boss releases fireballs. Now I can't play anymore.
The game is fine but it crashes when fighting the squid boss.
Great game, but constantly crashes during boss fights. Currently stuck and unable to progress due to crashes.

Great Game! It works great on both my Shield Tablet K1 and S8+. It has cloud saving which makes switching on both easy. Also, it has controller support which make using it on something like the Shield Tablet K1 better.
I play ff7-14 and 3re. I think I'm 'new generation' anddd this game is too expensive for super so-so RPG.  I know it is old... still not worth the money. If you want to try, wait for discount.
Can't get past the mansion in jadd due to a game crashing bug which won't allow you to fight davius. There are too many sprites which overloads the game. Absolutely ridiculous.
Please,im in desert.But I don't know what to do,where I have to go to find the desert cave but I don't know what to do
Game keep crashing at davias!!!!!
Crash during boss fight (davias). Please fix and will give 5 stars.
One of the best square Enix has to offer , controller support ,  full screen,  smooth game play , cloud support , what more could u ask for
Game crashes repeatedly at Devias boss battle. Google search shows that players have been complaining about this for months. That says a lot about the devs these days at SE.
Good game but crashes halfway through

Fantastic game so far but it crashes with every boss fight. It's crashed at least twice for each boss and I'm currently on the Davias boss battle, but am unable to beat it as the app crashes every time there is too much activity on the screen. Ignoring the crashing however, it is addictive and fun to play even for someone who has not played the original Final Fantasy Adventure.

I love this game but the game keeps crashing when I am fighting Davias. I use a Samsung S7 and when the game crashes it doesn't show me what error it had. I want to give this game 5 start rate but can't

Very fun port, but the bugs make it nonplayable. First, the mansion roof. Leveled up to beat it fast enough and made it through. Now at the very end of the game, same issue. I guess it has to do with the graphics being too much. Fix and will give 5 stars.
Game keeps crashing during the Davias boss fight makes the game unplayable past this point please fix. Galaxy S8+

Game consistently crashes whenever the red mage touches an ice tile. 100% reproduce rate. I've tried restarting my phone, reinstalling the app, and starting the game over. I'm on Galaxy S7 running Android 7.
Thi is fun and exciting
I experienced lagging and not very happy with the battle system. Was expecting something similar to the Final Fantasy series but it's nothing close. I'm quite disappointed with this game.
Always error and going out from the game avery time i played at old mansion's roof

MAJOR BUG!!! This is an amazing game but after playing awhile you get to Davais the boss of Jadd and unfortunately  the game will cut out after he starts throwing fire balls every time! Have tries restarting game and repeating for over 12 times now! Please fix!!! Amazing game so far!

I really really wanted to give this game 5 stars. It is a beautiful remake of my first and favorite rpg of all time, Final Fantasy Adventure. Unfortunately, the game consistently crashes during the Davias fight, which makes it unplayable past that point. I'm playing on Nexus 5x. This game is too expensive to have game breaking bugs like this. If they address this issue I would rate 5 stars for sure.

Great game, but the port has some problems. It is very hard to properly control on a touch screen because the center of the "analog stick" moves on the screen as to move your finger. Most people experience a game breaking crash at a mid game boss, and it's possible to get stick in a later dungeon and have to rely on a very low drop rate to find the keys needed to progress. The graphics and sound are amazing, but the fact that the gameplay hasn't been updated in the 25 years since its original release hurts it.  If you are interested, ALWAYS HAVE 12+ KEYS WHEN YOU LEAVE A SHOP!
„ÇØ„Éº„É´
Solid remake, but it crashes during the fight with Davias every time. I can't get past it. I'll change my review if and when this is fixed.

Don't buy this game. There's a bug at a certain boss fight of the game that keeps crashing over and over, no matter what you do. I tried uninstalling, didn't work. I tried emailing square enix support and didn't get reply. I saw people posting here about same problem 7-8 months ago and there is still no solution. Developers abandoned the game. It should be removed from Google play store.

For those who dont know. This game was one of the very first final fantasy games released for the gameboy classics.  It went by the title Final Fantasy Adventure when it was first initially released.  For those who found this game disatisfying, please understand that this game was considered one of the greatest storylines that made final fantasy what it is today.  Not many know it but this was one of the greatest tragic tales Final Fantasy has ever released.  The endings an awesome twist as well.  Play to find out.

So good. I love that the classic soundtrack is an option. Most of the time I prefer that over the new soundtrack. Touch controls are decent as well as controller support. Also while sword of mana was a great reimagining this is a great straight up faithful remake.
i cant give this a review whenever i try to open it it says "download failed‚Äã because you  may not have purchased the app" even though i have paid

This is a lovely remaster of the original gameboy game. It has some nice quality of life improvements while keeping the original design intact. For those who want a complete reimagining of the original, there's also Sword of Mana for the Gameboy Advance.

played with my Samsung note 5. no lags, everything is smooth. had so much fun with this game.. no grinding, no stress, just fun and adventure.. though the story is quite tragic.. still.. an excellent game.
Game is great but controls are buggy. Character keeps running to the bottom right corner, unless I'm actively trying to go in another direction. Makes it hard to select anything.
Very faithful remake. Controls are better than you could really expect on mobile.
Enix is not good as before,we expected more,maybe it's was our fault that expected a lot of this great company.

The game sucks overall. There's no guidance for one. How do you remember your next mission if the game doesn't offer an icon or prompt between missions. There's no real battles. Boss levels are easy, just like playing the regular monsters, and the partners that join you doesn't do a thing but shoot out random magic. Leveling up doesn't make a difference either. Just basic and not adventurous for me to keep playing. Who ever gave this game high ratings flat out lied, or the developer's paid them. Don't waste your money.
This game is just horrible...
Complete in 7 hour  This game is great. I'm very enjoy it
Awesome game but controls are a little  sluggish.
Bugged, constantly crashes at the old mansion boss fight. No way to pass
I like the game so far, it includes a bunch of cool stuff and thing you can do, the graphics are not as good as other games I've played, but still a really addictive game
Works with my beboncool Bluetooth controller. Very pleased with the controls. Touch screen controls are pretty good as well but seriously get a Bluetooth controller you will be happy you did
My first Mana title growing up. Couldn't wait for a good remake like Sword of Mana (Seiken Densetsu). This was an excellent purchase.

Persistent bug fighting the boss in the Old Mansion - the game force closes when there is a lot of on-screen activity, so there is no way to advance. Also appears as though the last update was over a year ago.  Developers should either remove this from Google Play, or note that it may not function correctly on newer devices. I would love to see an ETA for a solid update. If none, I will request a refund.
Fun as always

This is a great remaster of the first game in the Mana series (or Seiken Densetsu series). It did everything that I could have hope for: updated visuals, smother controls (this game has 360 degree movement while the original only had 4 directional movement), and the option to change the music from its remastered tracks to the classic chiptune soundtrack at will. The negatives that I do have about this game (such as the story being relatively the same and minimal and the problem of the control going crazy after a while of playtime) aren't enough to ruin the joy I had with this remake.

A highly entertaining game to play for an hour or two - frequent autosaves mean you can put down at basically any time. Be warned though, AOM is an action rpg that progresses really quickly! Best if savored over several days.  IMO it plays more like a Zelda title than a Square Enix classic (in terms of puzzles, dungeons, combat, and the timing of obtaining new toys throughout the game), but the way the story/plot progresses is pretty similar to how Secrets of Mana progresses (though AOM seems a lot shorter). If you liked Swordigo on android, this is a nice game for following that (Swordigo has no sequel but I think we all want one after playing it - while AOM is not a platformer, the RPG nature of character development in this game probably inspired the likes of Swordigo, and the animation/graphics are very similar to that game too) I love the animation in this game also and I don't normally notice that kind of thing. Note the shopkeeper's dance - 10/10. I wish the world map music was less intense!!
can not play  because it will not save the game  something is wrong

-Pros: Awesome graphics/music and sound. Cloud saving. -Cons: Generic buildings, they all look the same, with the same dialogue. Too many screen shifting. Most textures seem copy-and-paste-like, ex: the vines you climb horizontally are vines that are designed vertical looking. The item menu is a huge mess and is a pain to switch items/weapons/spells. Spells are a mess and you have to be facing too accurately towards your enemy to not be wasting MP, same with weapons (but that's not too much of an issue.)
Nice port, but I can't finish because it crashes every time I fight the squid guy in the mansion. Kind of a deal breaker.
Beautiful low poly model with gorgeous saturated textures. Game is fun from beginning to end
Like some users here, the game keep crashing at the top of the old mansion during the octopus boss fight. The gameplay is a bit dull because it s too simple but i enjoy everything else in the game

Had a save issue so I originally rated it one star, but it seems to be fixed. Other than a couple glitches the game is perfect. I'm glad they stuck as close as possible to the original. I've been playing the mana series and wanted to go back to the first one, this is way more fun than a game boy game!
Bug
What an amazing port of a great game!
Crashes on my Nexus 6P when bosses use certain moves... Makes it impossible to progress

I love the story so far, but my problem is that the controls think that I'm going diagonally down and to the right whenever I'm not touching it. It's really annoying, especially when I walk into a building and suddenly I'm outside again. Also, some of the enemies seem to walk straight through walls.  You may have 4.3 stars, but there's still bugs that have been around since June 2016--that's an awfully long time since a last update to fix bugs. Please update the game, I really want to enjoy it without wrestling control of my hero from the computer.
GP is capped at 65,535
Great game
Like playing the game but it just not so like 3.....d style. Just that but I like playing the game

Runs beautifully, touch controls take some time getting used to. Story is exactly the same as the original. Don't listen to the people giving negative reviews. They either never played Final Fantasy Adventure and/or are trying to run the game on a modified device. They're giving low points out of ignorance.
I really like this game but I can't stop running South please fix or refund
I really like it!
I LOVED THIS GAME! I never played the original but this was exactly what I was looking for to play on my down. Cute, fun and easy to play!
Played up to the desert where I got the chocobo: screen sans rings and controls went black. According to the minimap, I wound up in some potion venders house. Please fix your damn games.

This is the update that Final Fantasy Adventure really deserved! The controls are very intuitive and the new additions are great without taking away from the original gameplay I loved. The music and story are just as phenomenal with their new arrangements, and if I had one complaint, it's that I don't remember the Mantis Ant being this hard the first time around...
A great remake of the original. The touch screen controls can be a bit frustrating however. Still, its other features make up for it.

As far as modern remakes of old games go, this is about as faithful as it gets. The 3D enemy models, the world, the dungeons, and pretty much all elements in the game were all recreated with great precision, but with nice, small variations, such as changing certain ways the bosses attacked and moved, adding subtle elevation changes into the world map, and I particularly liked the addition of a second sickle. The rerecording of the music is glorious. This is hands down my favorite game soundtrack ever.

Awesome game, loved the classic gb version too. I just recently started a new file but the enemies in the eastern cave won't spawn unless I save my file inside the cave, close the game, and then open the game again. The real problem is that the enemies, once I do get them to spawn,  won't drop a mattock so I can't progress any further :[ Haaalp please
About 4 hours in during. The desert and. Glitched to the ocean.  And now I'm SOL

The developers thought it would be good to keep a bug in from TWENTY YEARS AGO - when you get to glaive Castle there's a bit where you get stuck between two locked doors. If you don't have keys you're forced to reset all your progress. Absolutely shambolic of square Enix. Disgusting.

I regret paying for this game so much. I hate games that I have to use walkthroughs on in order to make progress, but you'll need it. The map is so convoluted and indirect, it's pointless.  Have fun getting lost for hours. The ncp's are so basic, one line, no change for most before/after an event occurs. The houses are glitched looking. Overall I'd say this looks and feels like a student project, or maybe something thrown together over a weekend just to make money on. I'd rather play something in 8bit that had more depth, I feel like this is something that should be free to play, and flooded with ads, it's just terrible.
Mejor que el de gba

The original game was my first RPG ever. I loved it and still do! The 'remake' Sword of Mana was crap compared to the original Seiken Densetsu. But this game lives up to the legend. No five star ranking due to crappy touch controls (which suck in general). Please bring this one to consoles!!! Would even pay a lot more for a port and hence better controls!

Update: 4.5 hours in, just after Jadd in the desert, I was glitched into the ocean while riding my Chocobo while moving between area. I'm now unable to get back onto land, or dismount. Completely SOL now.*** I adore this remake as much as I adored the original, Final Fantasy Adventure. It's beautifully done without detracting from the original mechanics that I loved. Sword of Mana was a lovely remake as well, but this didn't redo a lot of the story and gameplay, so it's a nice refresh.

The game is boring and bad. Dpad is hard to aim. The variation in weapon, magic etc is very simple and boring. The useless tag along comrades which does nothing but shooting randomly. The constant frequent need of changing weapons and items for each and every damn steps during the quest. The recycling of monsters on latter staged dungeons because too lazy to create new monsters. Do not buy this crap. It is a very low quality product for people who rarely plays rpgs.
I'm poisoned, walking to other room, auto-save run, I died. Reload save, died again.

It's a good and entertaining game so far, especially on mobile, but it keeps crashing on the mansion roof when you fight the octopus boss.  Wish I could finish the game, but it looks more like my money will go to waste
Perfect remake
The best you could expect from a remake of a gameboy game.  I would recommend using a tablet and controller to get the most out of it.
Barely feels like a mobile game, if you want classic old school action jrpg this is the way to go!
Also love music option!!

Not as solid or as original a remake as Sword of Mana for the GBA, but still very much worth playing. Unlike Sword, this is nearly an exact remake of FFA. So for those that want that in a remake, look no further. Controls take some getting used to, but still won't hold back the fun of it.
Great re-imagining of one of my favorite Final Fantasy games from the original Gameboy.
This is by a mile the best mobile rpg out there

Oh this brings back memories of the original Gameboy version...which I played many times.  Updated graphics make this a great edition. It is short,  but the fun part is replaying it while focusing on different stats.  For instance, try a play through while only putting stat points into speed. Worth the buy.

Good port. like that it's basically a 3d remake of the gameboy game been playing with the gameboy soundtrack and loving that as well game is a little buggy in some places but besides that I really enjoy this game
Fantastic game but I forgot how short it was.

I like the game alot, great remake my only problem is that frequently during game play my character will get "stuck" running down to the right making game play incredibly difficult, I have to close out of the game and go back to it sometimes several times before it stops and sometimes within minutes it'll start doing it again, when I'm not touching the screen at all the character just keeps running southeast ward it's annoying, I don't know if anyone else has expirienced this problem but I with it get fixed
I got stuck because my chocobo is elsewhere. Now I cannot leave the island. I have to restart but great game and fast pace.
Very dope ui conveniences added
It keep on re download and reinstalling afk it is 100% done. I can't play de game at all.

The controls are a bit tricky at first when fighting but once you get the hang of it, its a piece of cake. I definitely like the slight humor it gives and how cute the characters look. Truthfully this game is a 5 star. But recently when I got a new phone, the game became glitchy. All of a sudden my character keeps going to the far bottom right and when I go to the menu screen, it keeps going to different choices. It kept pissing me off. I've tried uninstall and installing but no luck.
I would like a refund this game is nothing like I thought and it never tells you anything I hate it and would like a refund please a waste of $10
Some of the best game play I know excellent game if there was a six star I would give it out of 5
The joystick control is bugged, and now the character always runs to the bottom right. Sooooooooo annoying is there any chance of this getting fixed?

Final Fantasy Adventure was one of the most fun games I ever played. This doesn't do it justice. It's bulky, I can't target monsters 1/2 the time. The menu is confusing. I should have saved my $13 and just download a rom if the original.             ***UPDATE*** I gave it another chance and it grew on me. I got the hang of it and am having fun.
Joystick gets stuck moving me to bottom right of screen. Same glitch from secret of mana seemingly?

Faithful remake of a kind of bad Gameboy game. Gamepad support is nice. Android TV support is great. Automated canned response telling me to register on your site to get support is an insult aggravated by the fact that said site is entirely and only dedicated to the 'big' console games.

Like Mark McKenzie, got stuck in "Glaive Castle 1F" between two locked doors.  Unlike other similar areas, this particular section of the castle never spawns Skeletons.  Given that this burned Mark, this issue has been around since February 2016 (or earlier).  I also experienced one crash, though one crash after several hours of gameplay isn't a disaster.
Wowowowoow

Downloaded and found my old volume of Nintendo Power issue  #28.  Remember it on my old gameboy growing up. Love this new improved Final Fantasy Adventure. Playing with the throwback music is a trip down memory lane. Takes a bit time to edit the control but it works excellent for touch screen. Party on dudes.
My only gripes are the occasional crashes but otherwise the game is excellent with the nice addition of Bluetooth controller support.
Had a great time playing Final Fantasy Adventures on Gameboy. Had a great time with the remake. Thanks Square! Now to remake Secret of Mana!

Though this is a Final Fantasy game, it plays a lot like a retro Zelda. It reminds me of A Link to the Past or something. Same concept pretty much. It requires a lot of thinking and not just focused on combat. I like the way the story is flowing so far

The game graphics would glitch frequently and it would occasionally force close,  usually when changing weapons from the quick item slots.  The story and gameplay were both excellent, however.

A great remake that upgrades the gameboy adventure into the modern asthetics, without adding weird new gimmicks or twisting the game into something different entirely. One of my favorite games as a kid (struggles of playing an old gb in the dark :/ ) this is easily one of my faves now!
Game launches then immediately closes. Uninstalled and reinstalled, problem remains. No refund option for a game that i can't play, so 1 star until something is resolved.
Nice songs and story old school love it. But I hope it will be more difficult and please update so we can bring forward our lv etc to new game after completing it. (We want replay value!)
Everything was identical to the original. While some of the kooky dialog has been fixed, and the graphics updated, it's the exact same game with a new shell.
It keeps on going to the bottom right side of the screen and keeps on turning off.

And I'm regretting wasting ¬£10+ on this game. It's nothing like I expected, less polished than secret of mana and just feels confusing and monotonous. Shame, should have gone with my instinct and bought FF9.

I originally completed this game back in the 90s so I was pretty excited when I found out they released a remake in 3D. The game itself is very fluid and smooth and the controls are very well implemented. The story is very simple and there's not much to it, the fun in this game is definitely in the gameplay. If you're a fan of classic Zelda titles like Link's Awakening and A link to the past, this game plays similarly. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this to anyone who likes classic Zelda style gameplay.
best game.....
Yes
A must play on the android, uses a slightly modified version of the combat system that compliments it perfectly
Loved every bit of it.

This is the perfect remake of the original. The only thing that would be better is if a higher level of difficulty was available. The PlayStation Vita would have been perfect for this game. Or the Nintendo DS

Played final fantasy adventure as a child when i was 11 loved it.  Was one of my all time favorites. And playing this remake at age 26 is a nice walk in memory lane.     Nothing is perfect people will complain. So give it a shot for yourself and experience one of the best RPG games in hand held history

Great story, beautiful graphics, and easy to use menus.  a must buy.  I never buy games like this on my phone because I prefer handheld consoles with a physical joystick and buttons, but the game looked so good that i bought it anyway and I'm glad I did, as a jrpg fan I highly recommend it.

Very true to the source material while having a nice new coat of paint. The original game is one of my favorite Gameboy games. It certainly deserves a remake and Square Enix delivered a pretty decent one. Price point is kind of high, if I hadn't played the original I probably wouldn't have bought it, but I'm glad I did.

Seems fun so far, but even the enhanced touch controls are still not good enough imo. A huge improvement, sure, but not adding controller support regardless continues to be a stupid trend from the developer. Please add controller support, it's not like it's overly difficult, considering they're added it to other titles just fine.

Character keeps running South for a reason the settings don't seem to solve. I loved the original and the remake looks and runs beautifully, fix the bug and I'll change my rating. Update: character is now constantly running East. Please make a patch so I can play my game. Update- Still having same problem and your tech people keep telling me I don't give them enough info.
Loved it

So the game isn't bad... it has a fairly good story, and seems to be 95% identical to the original Final Fantasy Adventure for the GB. But for the price tag I expected it to go further/deeper, like Sword of Mana did on the GBA (another remake of the original Mana game, but better). My biggest disappointment is that there are no classes. I want to be able to turn my dude into a dragon master or paladin. If you enjoyed the original, then you may like this game.. if not, save your money, or get the GBA version
Just paid a lot of money for a very disappointed game! What were they thinking? Nothing about this game is addictive or even any fun! Buyer be ware!
Don't remember the original very much but I know it was a really good game. I just started this game and it's pretty good.
Fantastic remake ;)
Very boring game. Fighting is not complex. You literally only have 1 2 or 3 techniques per weapon. Beat it in 3 days. Bosses are cake. No need for defense. Game should only be $3.

This remake is the greatest game in the mana series to date. It surprising how much attention to detail was placed in the recreation of this game. I'll go as far as saying not even the Legend of Zelda can top this masterpiece. Thank SquareEnix for such a wonderful game.

Loved Final Fantasy Adventure on the original gameboy, and this is a super remake of that title.  It is a much more loyal remake than the GBA version was.  Now that Android TV is officially supported, this is the version of FFA to own.  Now I have a reason to go out and buy a DualShock 4 controller.  Thank you Square!

I love this game from when it first started up. Graphics. Music. A must own for every mana fan out there. Bluetooth controller compatible also. Don't let the price tag scare you. You get what you pay for here

Controls are good. Game itself is fun. Just finished it. Only bugs I noticed were if I multitasked to a different app when I came back to AOM it glitches every time. Easy fix. Fully close and reopen. Quick loading game so no big issue for me. Galaxy S6

I didn't see other reviews from this device, so I thought I'd confirm that it works well.  About the closest you're going to get to the Legend of Zelda on Android. As someone who never got to play the original for the Game Boy, this is a great way to experience the game that preceded Secret of Mana.
Awesome!
Can't stop playing it. Great story and better than zelda.

The game was good. Music was really good. Not much story to it though. Decent amount of weapons and armor. Don't put in the code at the armor smith. If you do you're stuck with that armor for the rest of the game.
I had no idea this game existed prior to a few months ago, so this game is new to me.  This reminds me of a fancy version of the original Legend of Zelda. Nice job!
Play with a controller!
Maybe not worth 10 dollars compared to others. But still a great solid game.

If you played the original Gameboy version, the music here may bring you to tears, of joy that is. Please Square Enix, do the Final Fantasy Legend games next and I'll love you till I die! Fantastic game, you MUST OWN THIS, NOW!
App never worked for me and stupid update didnt fix it.
Got the game to have fun while going to work. Was alot of fun but lasted a week. Oh well.

This game could have been so much better. For the price, you'd think they'd integrate some nice cutscenes and make the story feel more consistent. I'm very disappointed, especially since the preview of the game, before its release, made it out to be so much more than what it actually turned out to be. It's by all means a cute game, but definitely not worth the price tag.
Game is very addictive and love the controls but I'm having issues with a glitch when I was in the desert and now I'm stuck in the mountains with a black screen. Other than that awesome game
Faithful remake of one of the best games ever made
Uninstalled after finishing it due to little replay value. Otherwise fantastic game

Reminds me of old school zelda with a final fantasy twist. A great game from start to finish. If you can get over stocking your inventory with keys  to avoid back tracking, you should thouroughly enjoy this game. I say buy it no question.
Played the bejesus out of the original and am enjoying the hell out of this! Beautifully done!

I played the hell out of this on my old brick Gameboy as a kid. It's just as exciting today as it was back then! If you're a fan of the classics and don't want to resurrect ancient hardware to play it, this is the best remake. It blows Sword of Mana out of the water!
Had a blast playing it, 9+ hours all together. Ignore ''can't find keys'' post, you can find them from lower level monsters but still recommend buying extras to speed up the game. 8/10 mobile game
A good port in general, a bit cheep on animations and interactivity. But it will scratch your jrpg spot

The game is excellent but the controls are quite bad. There are 4 different settings for the virtual joystick, but a digital directional-pad would have sufficed.  This game is much closer to the original Gameboy than 2003's sword of mana, and looks excellent. This wasn't bad at all for 16 bucks.
Not even worth $free but I would feel better deleting it if I had not PD $14.00 for it. So high priced I thought it was going to be great in all aspects.

If you're stuck without keys, kill skeletons until they drop them.  Alternatively, use the vast resource known as the internet to look up how to get more keys.

Im stuck in Glaive castle due to poor game design. You have to buy keys in this game unlike zelda in which you find them in the stages. Not a big mobile gamer but this game has me addictied to playing it definitly worth the buy

Certainly not cheap for a Android game. However it's totally worth the money. Modernizing a classic without changing anything about the gameplay or story. Automatically one of the best RPGs on your phone.
Perfect remake of a game that made my childhood so worderful graphic are superb and the soundtrack is so awesome !!! An easy 5 star !

Final Fantasy Adventure(orginal gameboy) was one of my favorite rpg games of all time. It was what Zelda wasn't, and that did it well, with a Squaresoft feel.  I put it up there with Final Fantasy 2 and 3(american numbered), and the original Sega Phantasy Star. Im so pleased to be playing a competely reskinned FF Adventure! If this game wasn't for mobile devices,  I would really love it. It's to big for my device and apparently can't be moved to the SD card. Final Fantasy Adventure was one of my favorite games as a kid. I thought of the game often throughout the years. I'd often find myself humming the overworld theme. It left a lasting impression on me. When I saw that they were remaking it for mobile. I was very excited. The game is still fun as ever, but it does show its age. Item management is poor and often annoying. I feel they could have streamlined some of the systems without losing the charm of the original game. They also could have updated the enemy AI a little bit and balanced the difficulty a little better. This is an incredibly easy game. Anyone with any video game experience will probably never be even in danger of dying. All in all though, I still recommend it. It's fun, especially if you enjoyed the original.

I've only ever played and beaten Sword of Mana. I'm about seven hours in this game and I've enjoyed every bit of it. I'm hoping Square-Enix considers remaking other games in the series and localize the third that never made it to the United States. This isn't an easy game that holds your hand. Be very weary that this is a gameboy game hence the difficulty. If you want a challenging game to play on your phone, this is the one. This is an extremely polished game.

Wonderfully replicates the original gameboy experience that I so enjoyed  25 years ago! Sadly, there will be many who bemoan the price who seem to have little perspective of value. This is not ad/iap-riddled trash folks.

Beat it in 12 hours. I love how they kept the original story and game play as it was originally intended as FFA, and not Sword of Mana. Only issues I had was switching back and forth from apps, sometimes the graphics would glitch. Thank you Square Enix for an awesome revamp. Great graphics and sound, very faithful to the original, absolutely worth the money!

Supports ipega controller out of the box, touch control is still pretty good, music is great recreation of the old 8 bit music with actual instruments, graphics look great... Very good buy, love square for releasing quality mobile games like this :-D
Is there some graphic bug issue? When I opened it what I can see is black things surrounding the minimal and the menu

I've noticed some complaints of the menu being clunky as well some other trivial gripes. The game is essentially a port of Final Fantasy Adventure from the game boy. You can't compare this to recent or similar entries, because the game was a genesis for the genre. Bearing that in mind, the graphics are beautiful, and the updated soundtrack certainly doesn't disappoint. A great game in it's own right, however it's age does show. I was hoping there might have been some content added for replay value though.
Love this game!
Final Fantasy Adventure returns!
Great game. Best way to describe the game is a mix between Zelda with Final Fantasy. Good action RPG
The game may LOOK like a generic $1 game, but it plays like a Mana game (such as Secret of Mana). Lot of fun so far. Stock up on mattocks and keys.
Yes!!!! Thank you square soft for remaking this amazing final fantasy game.

Despite having some reservations about playing an ARPG on a touch screen they've done a really good job. Plays well and is a nice rendition of the original. Highly recommended to anyone considering it and works flawlessly on my phone, (LG G3).
Good fun! Great sounds and music. Game play is very simplistic perhaps very basic but overall a fun and harking back to the old mixed with the new.
Please add option to hide sword icons on UI.  Don't need them with controller.

This is my first time playing an entry of the series. It's better than most mobile games out there so there's that. Some things that bother me are that it doesn't seem finished/tested. Quit playing the tripe that plagues app stores, buy this game and be happy you did. One of the greatest handheld games of the GameBoy era has been totally remade and surprisingly plays excellently. This should be a lesson to both mobile game developers and Square Enix on how to do things right.

This is the greatest remake of Final Fantasy Adventure!

Really solid remake! The software controller works better than most of SQEX's games and feels accurate. The menus are nicely optimized and the game runs well even on an older device. The new art style fits this game well; I like the whimsical look and feel moreso than how it looked in Sword of Mana. Can't wait to see if the rumors are true about SD2 and 3 following in this game's footsteps!
I loved the original on game boy, and liked the remake on game boy advance... But this remake takes the cake! Great graphics, excellent game play and I love the new added storyline.
Please do more mana games like secert of mana 2
Feels pretty good. Is takes me back. Well see if it holds up.

Seriously, the music is incredible. The controls and visuals are pretty good. The story... Is pretty basic. If you are looking for a good looking adventure game with a really classic feel, this is what you are looking for!
